bugs.description: In POSIX implementation of trigger._physical_pull(), the code writes a byte to the pipe without catching exceptions. If the pipe’s buffer becomes full (EAGAIN / BlockingIOError), os.write will raise, which can propagate out of pull_trigger() and crash the calling thread or even the whole application. The method should catch EAGAIN and silently ignore (or flush) because the wake-up signal has already been queued, or otherwise handle the error gracefully.
